title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers and Pete Carroll discuss returning to Foxborough; Carroll is now the Raiders' head coach.
The Patriots' new era begins with Mike Vrabel as head coach, marking the first without Bill Belichick.
Pete Carroll and Raiders players praise the strong front seven of the Patriots' defense, citing standout players.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown teamed up with YouTuber IShowSpeed for a live stream tour of Boston, including a re-enactment of the Boston Tea Party.
Brown humorously commented on taxes while tossing tea into the water like a basketball, alongside IShowSpeed in colonial-era attire.
The Celtics star also raced IShowSpeed in Downtown Crossing and later contested the race result after IShowSpeed claimed he pulled a hamstring.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, the Patriots' No. 4 draft pick, is set to debut against the Raiders on Sunday.
Patriots' offensive line coach Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's motor, dynamic run blocking, and technique.
Campbell received high preseason grades, yet is expected to face challenges against top NFL competition.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: UNC coach Bill Belichick has banned Patriots scouts from attending the school's football practices and games.
Mike Vrabel says Patriots will find alternative ways to gather information on UNC players amid the scouting ban.
Belichick's relationship with Patriots owner Robert Kraft remains tense after an acrimonious departure from New England.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student is suing the school for defamation after reporting alleged filming in unisex dorm showers.
The lawsuit claims URI failed to implement necessary security measures in its unisex restrooms, placing the plaintiff at risk.
James Paquette is facing a state-level charge for video voyeurism; URI allegedly misled media about the student's connection to him.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener due to a hamstring injury sustained in July.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for the Sunday game against the Raiders due to an ankle injury.
Patriots' defensive tackle Christian Barmore has been limited in practice, but not due to an injury.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is recovering from a ruptured Achilles tendon without a set timeline for his return.
Team president Rich Gotham states Boston Celtics are keeping options open for Tatum's potential season availability.
Celtics' Jordan Walsh reports Tatum's visible progress and impact on team morale during recovery.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Raiders begin a new era with head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith, having previously succeeded together in Seattle.
Tom Brady, now a minority owner of the Raiders, won't attend Sunday's game due to Fox Sports commitments.
Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty, a top draft pick, is the favorite for NFL Offensive Rookie of the Year, offering potential against a weak Patriots run defense.

title: What does it mean that TreVeyon Henderson is listed 3rd on the Patriots’ depth chart?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Rookie TreVeyon Henderson is listed as the third running back on the Patriots' depth chart behind Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson.
Henderson made an impact in preseason with a 100-yard kick return and an eight-yard rush touchdown against the Vikings.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel likely to maintain a committee backfield approach, potentially shifting running back roles throughout the season.

title: Here’s what fantasy football experts are saying about Patriots players in Week 1
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye is considered a fantasy 'sleeper' for Week 1 against the Raiders, given their middling pass defense.
Rhamondre Stevenson expected to be the primary ball carrier for New England despite attention around rookie TreVeyon Henderson.
Stefon Diggs is set to play Week 1 after rehabbing from a torn ACL, providing a reliable target for the Patriots' offense.
